1.name: Osborne House, Isle of Wight, UK
1.message: Osborne House, UK: In 1901, Queen Victoria died here at the age of 81, ending the Victorian era that shaped the modern world.

2.name: Washington, D.C., USA
2.message: Washington, D.C., USA: In 1902, the first Rose Bowl game was played, marking the beginning of college football bowl games.

3.name: Kitty Hawk, North Carolina, USA
3.message: Kitty Hawk, USA: In 1903, the Wright Brothers achieved the first powered, controlled airplane flight here.

4.name: St. Louis, Missouri, USA
4.message: St. Louis, USA: In 1904, the Summer Olympics were held here, the first Olympics held in the United States.

5.name: Princeton, New Jersey, USA
5.message: Princeton, USA: In 1905, Albert Einstein published his theory of special relativity while working at the patent office.

6.name: San Francisco, California, USA
6.message: San Francisco, USA: In 1906, a devastating earthquake struck here, destroying much of the city.

7.name: Paris, France
7.message: Paris, France: In 1907, Pablo Picasso painted 'Les Demoiselles d'Avignon,' revolutionizing modern art.

8.name: Detroit, Michigan, USA
8.message: Detroit, USA: In 1908, the Ford Model T went into production here, making automobiles affordable for the masses.

9.name: North Pole
9.message: Arctic: In 1909, Robert Peary claimed to have reached the North Pole, though this has been disputed.

10.name: Hollywood, California, USA
10.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1910, the first Hollywood film studio opened, marking the birth of the movie industry.

11.name: Machu Picchu, Peru
11.message: Machu Picchu, Peru: In 1911, Hiram Bingham 'rediscovered' this ancient Incan city, bringing it to world attention.

12.name: Atlantic Ocean
12.message: Atlantic Ocean: In 1912, the RMS Titanic sank here after hitting an iceberg, leading to major maritime safety reforms.

13.name: New York City, USA
13.message: New York City, USA: In 1913, the Armory Show introduced modern art to America, shocking the public.

14.name: Cleveland, Ohio, USA
14.message: Cleveland, USA: In 1914, the first electric traffic light was installed here, improving urban safety.

15.name: San Francisco to New York
15.message: Transcontinental USA: In 1915, the first transcontinental telephone call was made from coast to coast.

16.name: Memphis, Tennessee, USA
16.message: Memphis, USA: In 1916, the first self-service grocery store opened here, revolutionizing retail.

17.name: Washington, D.C., USA
17.message: Washington, D.C., USA: In 1917, the United States entered World War I, changing the course of the war.

18.name: Paris, France
18.message: Paris, France: In 1918, World War I ended with the armistice signed here, bringing peace to Europe.

19.name: Grand Canyon, Arizona, USA
19.message: Grand Canyon, USA: In 1919, the Grand Canyon was designated a National Park, preserving this natural wonder.

20.name: Washington, D.C., USA
20.message: Washington, D.C., USA: In 1920, the 19th Amendment was ratified, giving women the right to vote.

21.name: Toronto, Canada
21.message: Toronto, Canada: In 1921, insulin was first used to treat diabetes here, saving millions of lives.

22.name: Luxor, Egypt
22.message: Luxor, Egypt: In 1922, Howard Carter discovered King Tut's tomb here, the most intact pharaoh's tomb ever found.

23.name: New York City, USA
23.message: New York City, USA: In 1923, Time magazine was first published here, becoming a cornerstone of journalism.

24.name: Chamonix, France
24.message: Chamonix, France: In 1924, the first Winter Olympics were held here, establishing winter sports competitions.

25.name: London, UK
25.message: London, UK: In 1925, John Logie Baird demonstrated the first working television system here.

26.name: Auburn, Massachusetts, USA
26.message: Auburn, USA: In 1926, Robert Goddard launched the first liquid-fueled rocket here, advancing space technology.

27.name: New York City, USA
27.message: New York City, USA: In 1927, 'The Jazz Singer' premiered here, the first feature film with synchronized sound.

28.name: London, UK
28.message: London, UK: In 1928, Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin here, revolutionizing medicine.

29.name: Hollywood, California, USA
29.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1929, the first Academy Awards ceremony was held here, honoring film achievements.

30.name: Flagstaff, Arizona, USA
30.message: Flagstaff, USA: In 1930, Pluto was discovered at the Lowell Observatory here.

31.name: New York City, USA
31.message: New York City, USA: In 1931, the Empire State Building opened here as the world's tallest building.

32.name: Billund, Denmark
32.message: Billund, Denmark: In 1932, the LEGO company was founded here, creating the world's favorite building toy.

33.name: New York City, USA
33.message: New York City, USA: In 1933, 'King Kong' premiered here, becoming a cinematic monster movie classic.

34.name: Burbank, California, USA
34.message: Burbank, USA: In 1934, Donald Duck made his debut in a Disney cartoon produced here.

35.name: Atlantic City, New Jersey, USA
35.message: Atlantic City, USA: In 1935, the board game Monopoly was first sold here, becoming a global phenomenon.

36.name: Springfield, Massachusetts, USA
36.message: Springfield, USA: In 1936, the Basketball Hall of Fame was established here, honoring the sport's history.

37.name: Hollywood, California, USA
37.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1937, 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs' premiered here, the first full-length animated feature film.

38.name: Cleveland, Ohio, USA
38.message: Cleveland, USA: In 1938, Superman made his debut in Action Comics published here.

39.name: Hollywood, California, USA
39.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1939, 'The Wizard of Oz' premiered here, becoming a timeless classic.

40.name: Burbank, California, USA
40.message: Burbank, USA: In 1940, Tom and Jerry made their debut in a cartoon produced here.

41.name: New York City, USA
41.message: New York City, USA: In 1941, Captain America made his debut in comics published here.

42.name: New York City, USA
42.message: New York City, USA: In 1942, 'Casablanca' premiered here, starring Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman.

43.name: New York City, USA
43.message: New York City, USA: In 1943, Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry's 'The Little Prince' was published here.

44.name: Normandy, France
44.message: Normandy, France: In 1944, D-Day occurred here with the Allied invasion that turned the tide of World War II.

45.name: New York City, USA
45.message: New York City, USA: In 1945, World War II ended, bringing peace after six years of global conflict.

46.name: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA
46.message: Philadelphia, USA: In 1946, ENIAC, the first electronic general-purpose computer, was unveiled here.

47.name: Roswell, New Mexico, USA
47.message: Roswell, USA: In 1947, the famous 'Roswell incident' occurred here, fueling UFO conspiracy theories.

48.name: Switzerland
48.message: Switzerland: In 1948, Velcro was invented here by George de Mestral, revolutionizing fastening technology.

49.name: New York City, USA
49.message: New York City, USA: In 1949, George Orwell's dystopian novel '1984' was published here.

50.name: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA
50.message: Pittsburgh, USA: In 1950, the first credit card was issued here by Diners Club.

51.name: New York City, USA
51.message: New York City, USA: In 1951, J.D. Salinger's 'The Catcher in the Rye' was published here.

52.name: London, UK
52.message: London, UK: In 1952, Queen Elizabeth II ascended to the throne here following her father's death.

53.name: Cambridge, UK
53.message: Cambridge, UK: In 1953, Watson and Crick discovered the structure of DNA here at the Cavendish Laboratory.

54.name: New York City, USA
54.message: New York City, USA: In 1954, the first color television broadcast aired here.

55.name: Anaheim, California, USA
55.message: Anaheim, USA: In 1955, Disneyland opened here, becoming 'The Happiest Place on Earth.'

56.name: Memphis, Tennessee, USA
56.message: Memphis, USA: In 1956, Elvis Presley released 'Heartbreak Hotel' here, launching his legendary career.

57.name: Baikonur Cosmodrome, Kazakhstan
57.message: Baikonur, Kazakhstan: In 1957, Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite, was launched here by the Soviet Union.

58.name: Billund, Denmark
58.message: Billund, Denmark: In 1958, the modern LEGO brick was patented here, changing children's play forever.

59.name: Greensboro, North Carolina, USA
59.message: Greensboro, USA: In 1959, the Barbie doll was introduced here at the American International Toy Fair.

60.name: Washington, D.C., USA
60.message: Washington, D.C., USA: In 1960, the birth control pill was approved by the FDA here, revolutionizing reproductive rights.

61.name: Cape Canaveral, Florida, USA
61.message: Cape Canaveral, USA: In 1961, Yuri Gagarin became the first human in space, launched from here.

62.name: New York City, USA
62.message: New York City, USA: In 1962, Spider-Man made his debut in Amazing Fantasy #15 published here.

63.name: Washington, D.C., USA
63.message: Washington, D.C., USA: In 1963, Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his 'I Have a Dream' speech here during the March on Washington.

64.name: New York City, USA
64.message: New York City, USA: In 1964, The Beatles made their first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show here, sparking Beatlemania.

65.name: London, UK
65.message: London, UK: In 1965, the miniskirt was popularized here by designer Mary Quant.

66.name: Houston, Texas, USA
66.message: Houston, USA: In 1966, the first episode of Star Trek aired here, inspiring generations of science fiction fans.

67.name: San Francisco, California, USA
67.message: San Francisco, USA: In 1967, the Summer of Love occurred here, a cultural phenomenon of peace and music.

68.name: Uniontown, Pennsylvania, USA
68.message: Uniontown, USA: In 1968, the Big Mac was introduced by McDonald's here, becoming an American icon.

69.name: Kennedy Space Center, Florida, USA
69.message: Kennedy Space Center, USA: In 1969, Apollo 11 launched from here, leading to the first moon landing.

70.name: San Francisco, California, USA
70.message: San Francisco, USA: In 1970, the first Earth Day was celebrated here, launching the modern environmental movement.

71.name: Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA
71.message: Cambridge, USA: In 1971, the first email was sent here by Ray Tomlinson at BBN Technologies.

72.name: Sunnyvale, California, USA
72.message: Sunnyvale, USA: In 1972, Atari released Pong here, the first commercially successful video game.

73.name: New York City, USA
73.message: New York City, USA: In 1973, the first mobile phone call was made here by Motorola's Martin Cooper.

74.name: Budapest, Hungary
74.message: Budapest, Hungary: In 1974, Ern≈ë Rubik invented the Rubik's Cube here, the world's best-selling puzzle.

75.name: Albuquerque, New Mexico, USA
75.message: Albuquerque, USA: In 1975, Microsoft was founded here by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.

76.name: Los Altos, California, USA
76.message: Los Altos, USA: In 1976, Apple Computer was founded here in Steve Jobs' garage.

77.name: Hollywood, California, USA
77.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1977, 'Star Wars' premiered here, revolutionizing science fiction cinema.

78.name: Tokyo, Japan
78.message: Tokyo, Japan: In 1978, Taito released Space Invaders here, sparking the arcade game boom.

79.name: Tokyo, Japan
79.message: Tokyo, Japan: In 1979, Sony released the Walkman here, revolutionizing portable music.

80.name: Kennedy Space Center, Florida, USA
80.message: Kennedy Space Center, USA: In 1980, the first Space Shuttle mission launched from here.

81.name: Hollywood, California, USA
81.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1981, MTV launched here, changing music consumption forever.

82.name: Los Angeles, California, USA
82.message: Los Angeles, USA: In 1982, 'E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial' premiered here, becoming a cultural phenomenon.

83.name: San Francisco, California, USA
83.message: San Francisco, USA: In 1983, the Internet was born here with the formation of the Internet protocol suite.

84.name: Cupertino, California, USA
84.message: Cupertino, USA: In 1984, Apple introduced the Macintosh computer here, revolutionizing personal computing.

85.name: Kyoto, Japan
85.message: Kyoto, Japan: In 1985, Nintendo released Super Mario Bros. here, creating one of gaming's most iconic characters.

86.name: New York City, USA
86.message: New York City, USA: In 1986, the Statue of Liberty celebrated its centennial here with major renovations.

87.name: Springfield, USA
87.message: Springfield, USA: In 1987, 'The Simpsons' debuted here as a series, becoming a cultural institution.

88.name: Burbank, California, USA
88.message: Burbank, USA: In 1988, 'Who Framed Roger Rabbit' premiered here, blending live-action and animation.

89.name: Berlin, Germany
89.message: Berlin, Germany: In 1989, the Berlin Wall fell here, symbolizing the end of the Cold War.

90.name: Geneva, Switzerland
90.message: Geneva, Switzerland: In 1990, Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web here at CERN.

91.name: Moscow, Russia
91.message: Moscow, Russia: In 1991, the Soviet Union dissolved here, ending the Cold War era.

92.name: London, UK
92.message: London, UK: In 1992, the first SMS text message was sent here, revolutionizing communication.

93.name: Hollywood, California, USA
93.message: Hollywood, USA: In 1993, 'Jurassic Park' premiered here, showcasing groundbreaking CGI dinosaurs.

94.name: Tokyo, Japan
94.message: Tokyo, Japan: In 1994, Sony released the PlayStation here, revolutionizing the gaming industry.

95.name: Redmond, Washington, USA
95.message: Redmond, USA: In 1995, Microsoft released Windows 95 here, introducing the Start button to the world.

96.name: Roslin, Scotland, UK
96.message: Roslin, UK: In 1996, Dolly the sheep was cloned here, the first mammal cloned from an adult cell.

97.name: New York City, USA
97.message: New York City, USA: In 1997, IBM's Deep Blue defeated chess champion Garry Kasparov here.

98.name: Menlo Park, California, USA
98.message: Menlo Park, USA: In 1998, Google was founded here in a garage, changing how we access information.

99.name: Various Global Locations
99.message: Global: In 1999, the world prepared for Y2K, a computer bug that threatened global systems.

100.name: Global Celebration
100.message: Global: In 2000, the world celebrated the new millennium, marking the start of the 21st century.
